intro: Lagenophora billardierei var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal regions. It is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
